On man, 2005-12-12 at 11:45, SÃ¸ren Vejrup Carlsen wrote:
> We have encountered a new problem with the group-max-success-kb feature.
> It seems that robots.txt URI is not considered by QuotaEnforcer.
> These robots.txt are, however, included in the host-report.txt numbers.
> 
> Is this planned behaviour?
> 
> The robots.txt can be quite large: We have seen robots.txt up to 2.5
> Mbytes.

To shed some light (maybe) on the the problem, the update for the
host-report happens through StatisticsTracker.crawledURISuccessful,
called from CrawlController.fireCrawledURISuccessfulEvent.  Poking
around in ToeThread, which fires that event, I don't see any special
handling.  Could the fact that robots.txt is a prerequisite URI affect
the counting in host-report?  dns: is counted in a separate line in
host-report, and that's the only other prereq I can thinkg of.

-Lars
